奈良時代を再現、貴族・女官の衣装で「天平行列」

04 Nov 2019, 01:26



華やかな衣装で東大寺を参詣する「天平行列」の参加者ら（３日午後、奈良市で）＝長沖真未撮影

　奈良時代を再現した色鮮やかな衣装を身にまとい、東大寺に参詣する「天平行列」が３日、奈良市内で行われた。聖武天皇に扮（ふん）した俳優加藤雅也さんや、貴族や女官の装束姿の市民ら１２０人が、ＪＲ奈良駅から東大寺まで約３キロを練り歩いた。
　聖武天皇や光明皇后ゆかりの宝物が展示される正倉院展の時期に合わせ、２０１３年から毎年開催。参加者は、開催中の「御即位記念　第７１回正倉院展」に出展されている仏具「紫檀金鈿柄香炉（したんきんでんのえごうろ）」など宝物のレプリカを手に、ゆっくりと歩みを進めた。
text:
Recreating the Nara period, "Parallel rows" with costumes of aristocrats and female officers

04 Nov 2019, 01:26



Participants of “Ten-no-Parami” that visits Todaiji Temple in gorgeous costumes (Nara City in the afternoon of 3rd)

“A Ten Parallel Line” was held in Nara City on the 3rd, wearing colorful costumes that recreated the Nara period and visiting Todaiji Temple. Actor Masaya Kato, who was dressed as Emperor Seibu, and 120 citizens dressed as nobles and female officers, walked about 3 kilometers from JR Nara Station to Todaiji Temple.
Held every year since 2013 in line with the Shosho-in exhibition, where treasures related to Emperor Seibu and Empress Komyo are displayed. Participants slowly hold a replica of treasures, such as the Buddhist ware “Shikinden no Kogoro” exhibited at the 71st Shosoin Exhibition, which is being held. I went forward.
